snippet: The Calder Foundation has bought a sketch of Fernard Léger, done by Alexander Calder around 1945. And the work of René Lalique is being exhibited at the Corning Museum.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; Calder Foundation in Manhattan pays $4,800 for portrait of French artist Fernand Leger by Alexander Calder; exhibit Rene Lalique: Enchanted by Glass, opening May 17 at Corning Museum of Glass in Corning, NY, combines tableware, factory equipment, architectural salvage, trinkets and damaged objects by the French Art Deco designer.
lead_paragraph: The Calder Foundation has bought a sketch of Fernard Léger, done by Alexander Calder around 1945. And the work of René Lalique is being exhibited at the Corning Museum.

headline.main: A Glimpse of Léger, a Good Look at Lalique
headline.print_headline: A Glimpse of Léger, a Good Look at Lalique
